paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Introduction to Hive SQL
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive tables on Hadoop
**File locations:** /tmp/data/marvel-wikia-data.csv
**Successful outcome:** Understanding the differences between external and managed Hive tables
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Tranforming Data with Hive

---

paragraphs.title: Required for Kerberos operations
Setup the data context
paragraphs.text:
%sh

rm -f data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv
wget -nv -O  /tmp/data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/data/raw/master/comic-characters/marvel-wikia-data.csv
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /tmp/raw
hdfs dfs -put -f /tmp/data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv /tmp/raw
hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /tmp/raw

paragraphs.title: 1 - Display the Hive tables

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create a marvel_comics_raw **external** table to store our data.

~~~
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE marvel_comics_raw ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' LOCATION '/tmp/data'
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 2 - Drop table marvel_comics_raw if it exists
3 - Create a marvel_comics_raw external table

paragraphs.text:
%md
Now we are going to create a marvel_comics **managed** table to store our data.

~~~
 CREATE TABLE marvel_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) STORED AS ORC
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 9 - Drop table marvel_comics if it exists
10 - Create a marvel_comics managed table stored as ORC

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created and populated external and managed Hive tables.

---

paragraphs.title: 1 - Display the Hive tables

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 3 - Create a marvel_comics_raw external table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE marvel_comics_raw ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' LOCATION '/tmp/data/'

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 6 - Load the marvel comic data into our marvel_comics_raw table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

LOAD DATA  INPATH '/tmp/raw/marvel-wikia-data.csv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE marvel_comics_raw

paragraphs.title: 10 - Create a marvel_comic managed table stored as ORC
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

 CREATE TABLE marvel_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) STORED AS ORC

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 11 - Insert the data
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

INSERT INTO TABLE marvel_comics SELECT * from marvel_comics_raw

Additional resources
paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Tutorials](http://cloudera.com/tutorials.html) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community](https://community.cloudera.com) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Apache Spark Documentation](https://spark.apache.org/documentation.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Apache Zeppelin Project Home Page](https://zeppelin.apache.org) - official Zeppelin web site.
